controls.name: sizeY
controls.caption: Y-size
controls.description: This function averages the matrix by rectangle X-size x Y-size. If Y-size=0, X-size is used instead (square). X-size cannot be 0.

controls.name: centerY
controls.caption: Center Y
controls.description: Position of the center of the rectangle. This function averages by rectangle [x1..x2]x[y1..y2], where x1 = center X - X-size/2, y1 = center Y - Y-size/2 (truncated division for odd integers), x2-x1+1 = X-size, y2-y1+1 = Y-size. If X-size=Y-size=1, this function just shifts the image right and downward to (Center X, Center Y).

controls.name: strictDivision
controls.caption: Strict division
controls.description:
If set, the average value α of N numbers a1,a2,...,aN is calculated as α=(a1+a2+...+aN)/N: division operation is used.
If cleared, it is calculated as α=(a1+a2+...+aN)*μ, where μ=1.0/N is a real value (double type): multiplication operation is used. Usually it is faster, especially for floating-point elements, but results may be little different.

controls.name: rounding
controls.caption: Rounding
controls.description:
This flag is used for integer matrix elements.
If set, the real average value α is converted into integer result as (int)(α+0.5) or (long)(α+0.5) — usual Java cast of double value to integer type. For non-negative values (usual situation), it means rounding to the floor (⌊α+0.5⌋).
If cleared, this function does not add 0.5 and use simple cast (int)α or (long)α: it is little faster.
Note: this flag is also ignored for 64-bit long integers.

controls.name: twoStage
controls.caption: Two-stage mode
controls.description:
This flag used rarely. If set, this function calculates the average value in two stages: first, it averages rows, second, it averages elements of (already averaged) row. It can help to provide 100% compatibility with another averaging algorithms.
Usually should cleared.
